def_cn: 调查;民意调查;民意测验
def_en: If you carry out a survey, you try to find out detailed information about a lot of different people or things, usually by asking people a series of questions.

def_cn: 调查;对…作民意调查;对…进行民意测验
def_en: If you survey a number of people, companies, or organizations, you try to find out information about their opinions or behaviour, usually by asking them a series of questions.

def_cn: 总体研究;审视;全面观察
def_en: If you survey something, you look at or consider the whole of it carefully.
If you give something a brief survey or a quick survey, you look at or consider all of it quickly, but not in detail.
If someone carries out a survey of an area of land, they examine it and measure it, usually in order to make a map of it.
If someone surveys an area of land, they examine it and measure it, usually in order to make a map of it.

def_cn: (通常指为欲购房者作的)房屋鉴定
def_en: A survey is a careful examination of the condition and structure of a house, usually carried out in order to give information to a person who wants to buy it.

def_cn: 对(建筑物)进行评估;鉴定;检查
def_en: If someone surveys a house, they examine it carefully and report on its structure, usually in order to give advice to a person who is thinking of buying it.
